word: A new purpose now took possession of his mind. \93It was in the language of Israel,\94 said he, \93that the psalms were sung in the temple of Jehovah; and shall not the gospel speak the language of England among us? . . . Ought the church to have less light at noonday than at the dawn? . . . Christians must read the New Testament in their mother-tongue.\94 The doctors and teachers of the church disagreed among themselves. Only by the Bible could men arrive at the truth. \93One holdeth this doctrine, another that. . . . Now each of these authors contradicts the other. How then can we distinguish him who says right from him who says wrong? . . . How? . . . Verily, by God's Word.\94
